text.0: say bringing sacrifice to bounteous rudra this juice for drink to you whose wrath is fleeting.
text.1: with dyaus the asuras heroes i have lauded the maruts as with prayer to earth and heaven.
text.2: strong to exalt the early invocation are night and dawn who show with varied aspect.
text.3: the barren clothes her in widewoven raiment and fair morn shines with sūryas golden splendour.
text.4: cheer us the roamer round who strikes at morning the wind delight us pourer forth of waters.
text.5: sharpen our wits o parvata and indra may all the gods vouchsafe to us this favour.
text.6: and auśija shall call for me that famous pair who enjoy and drink who come to brighten.
text.7: set ye the offspring of the floods before you both mothers of the living one who beameth.
text.8: for you shall auśija call him who thunders as to win arjunas assent cried ghoṣā.
text.9: i will invoke that pūṣan may be bounteous to you the rich munificence of agni.
text.10: hear mitravaruṇa these mine invocations hear them from all men in the hall of worship.
text.11: giver of famous gifts kind hearer sindhu who gives fair fields listen with all his waters.
text.12: praised mitra varuṇa is your gift a hundred cows to the pṛkṣayāmas and the pajra.
text.13: presented by carfamous priyaratha supplying nourishment they came directly.
text.14: praised is the gift of him the very wealthy may we enjoy it men with hero children.
text.15: his who hath many gifts to give the pajras a chief who makes me rich in cars and horses.
text.16: the folk o mitravaruṇa who hate you who sinfully hating pour you no libations.
text.17: lay in their hearts themselves a wasting sickness whereas the righteous gaineth all by worship.
text.18: that man most puissant wondrously urged onward famed among heroes liberal in giving.
text.19: moveth a warrior evermore undaunted in all encounters even with the mighty.
text.20: come to the mans the sacrificers calling hear kings of immortality joygivers.
text.21: while ye who speed through clouds decree your bounty largely for fame to him the chariot rider.
text.22: vigour will we bestow on that adorer whose tenfold draught we come to taste so spake they.
text.23: may all in whom rest splendour and great riches obtain refreshment in these sacrifices.
text.24: we will rejoice to drink the tenfold present when the twicefive come bearing sacred viands.
text.25: what can he do whose steeds and reins are choicest these the allpotent urge brave men to conquest.
text.26: the sea and all the deities shall give us him with the golden ear and neck bejewelled.
text.27: dawns hasting to the praises of the pious be pleased with us both offerers and singers.
text.28: four youthful sons of maśarśāra vex me three of the king the conquering ayavasa.
text.29: now like the sun o varuṇa and mitra your car hath shone longshaped and reined with splendour.
